Trump lied to the American people. He downplayed the severity of the #coronavirus pandemic. 

Now, over 200,000 of our neighbors, family members, loved ones and friends have died. 

We have to vote him out.
RT @Obamacare This is a health care election.  Pass it on. https://twitter.com/woodhouseb/status/1307347068151910404 QT @woodhouseb This is a health care election.  Pass it on.

Make a plan to vote. There’s so much at stake. http://IWillVote.com

Haga su plan para votar. Hay mucho en juego: http://VoyAVotar.com
RELEASE: Cruz Applauds the Trump Administration for Enforcing Snapback Sanctions on Iran, Finalizing End of Iran Deal

.@HoustonChron: Cruz says Senate should confirm Justice Ginsburg's replacement before election https://www.houstonchronicle.com/politics/texas/article/Ted-Cruz-says-Senate-should-confirm-Justice-15579503.php?utm_campaign=CMS%20Sharing%20Tools%20(Premium)&utm_source=t.co&utm_medium=referral

.@townhallcom: Cruz Offers a Solid Reason for Filling Ruth Bader Ginsburg's Vacancy Now https://townhall.com/tipsheet/mattvespa/2020/09/19/history-is-on-the-gops-side-for-filling-ruth-bader-ginsburgs-legacy-and-mcconn-n2576501?1914
.@thehill: Cruz: Trump should nominate a Supreme Court justice next week https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/517190-cruz-trump-should-nominate-a-supreme-court-justice-next-week#.X2ZKBUTDmBQ.twitter
.@theblaze: Sen. Cruz explains the grave danger of not filling SCOTUS vacancy before election: 'A constitutional crisis' https://www.theblaze.com/news/ted-cruz-supreme-court-vacancy-election

.@RedState: Sen. Cruz Explains Why Even Democrats Should Want to Confirm a New Supreme Court Justice Before the Election https://www.redstate.com/nick-arama/2020/09/19/ted-cruz-explains-why-even-democrats-should-want-to-confirm-a-new-supreme-court-justice-before-election/

.@FoxNews: Sen. Cruz urges Senate to fill Ruth Bader Ginsburg's seat, warning of 'constitutional crisis' on Election Day https://www.foxnews.com/politics/ted-cruz-ruth-bader-ginsburg-death-supreme-court-justice
We cannot have Election Day come and go with a 4-4 Court. We risk a constitutional crisis if we do not have a 9-Justice Supreme Court, particularly when there is such a risk of a contested election.

Stood on the steps of the Supreme Court tonight with thousands to say: Mitch McConnell thinks this fight is over. What he does not understand is that this fight has just begun. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiUgR7gXYAIjnHc.jpg

Our grief is real, but we cannot slip into despair. We simply can't afford it—too much is at stake.

Today’s the day to honor Ruth with action. Today’s the day to channel grief into change. Today's the day to dig a little deeper and buckle up for an uphill fight.

Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump will try to name a new Justice with just weeks to the election. This is the last desperate gasp of a corrupt Republican leadership that doesn’t reflect the views or values of our people. 

Let me be clear: No confirmation before the inauguration.

Ruth was a fighter. 

No matter how hard the battle, she didn’t give up—and neither do we. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiTLVRDWsAAQ7ig.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1307392718600052737/vid/320x320/hJJP7j5q09lFNlzq.mp4?tag=13

Fighting for progress is hard, and sometimes it can seem like our labor is in vain. 

But we can’t back down. We can’t lose hope. 

We must persist until we’ve built an America where our basic human rights aren’t just upheld, but enshrined.

RT @AOC Now is not the time for cynicism or hopelessness. There is and continues to be political possibility to preserve our democracy & move forward.

It will require each & every one of us, from the streets to the Senate, to grow in courage, strength, and strategy. But it is possible.

We have to keep fighting.

To take back the presidency. To flip the Senate. To protect our democracy. To preserve and expand justice for all.

To honor Ruthie’s most fervent wish. https://twitter.com/nprpolitics/status/1307101950115229696 QT @nprpolitics Just days before her death, as her strength waned, Ginsburg dictated this statement to her granddaughter Clara Spera: "My most fervent wish is that i I will not be replaced until a new president is installed." https://www.npr.org/2020/09/18/100306972/justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg-champion-of-gender-equality-dies-at-87?utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=politics&utm_term=nprnews&utm_source=twitter.com

Sen. Rubio surveyed the damage caused by #HurricaneSally and met with local officials to discuss recovery efforts in #SantaRosa and #Escambia counties.

Al conmemorar los aniversarios de los terremotos que azotaron a México en 1985 y en el 2017, nos unimos al pueblo de México para honrar y rezar por los que perecieron.  # FuerzaMéxico
As we commemorate the anniversaries of the deadly earthquakes that struck #Mexico in 1985 and 2017, we join the people of Mexico in honoring and praying for those who perished. #FuerzaMéxico

20 years ago, America opened up trade with #China, and it left a permanent scar on our families, our communities, and our country. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1307157325917097984/img/SsMk4DgPHBCY2T13.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1307157325917097984/vid/480x270/X_zQ0QD6d9_qJ5JT.mp4?tag=13

This is what authoritarianism looks like. An American president does not praise violence against a reporter for doing his job. That is what an ugly, insecure two-bit dictator does. The future of our democracy and a free press is at stake this election. We must defeat Trump badly. https://twitter.com/davidgura/status/1307318498205425665 QT @davidgura "He got hit on the knee with a canister of tear gas," President Trump says, of @AliVelshi, who was actually hit by a rubber bullet. "Wasn't it really a beautiful sight? It's called law and order." http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307101167571345409/pu/img/VeQCvOAk1tPudJ6Q.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307101167571345409/pu/vid/480x270/UeLaitSDizoiNQjU.mp4?tag=10

RT @johannabarr .@AOC hailed RBG in an interview with @RebeccaRuiz and said the fact that the death of a single, important individual could set off the political furor that it had raised “serious questions about the state of democracy in the United States.”

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/19/us/politics/aoc-ruth-bader-ginsburg.html

RT @HardingReports As Republicans show support for moving forward with a Supreme Court nominee quickly, @AOC tells me if that happens, “we should leave all options on the table, including the number of Justices that are on the Supreme Court.” Adds expanding is “absolutely” an option worth weighing. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307422242037432320/pu/img/MuoU_yPbiV02hpfT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307422242037432320/pu/vid/480x270/CkRW1T5Hc7riE2LP.mp4?tag=10

And after we work to command victory in November, I need folks to realize that there’s no going back to brunch.

We have a whole new world to build. We cannot accept going back to the way things were, & that includes the Dem party. We must deliver transformative, material change. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307380238461161473/pu/img/OuXqUgF5G4xbdKef.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307380238461161473/pu/vid/320x320/w7Lgdzi54gXmDTVm.mp4?tag=10

Here’s what we’re NOT gonna do: give up.

We don’t give up when people need us most. That’s not who we are.

Our democracy is at a faint heartbeat; it was broken even before Trump. But so long as we can save lives, I believe we have an obligation to do so as we build a new world. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307378628091695107/pu/img/q-3K2TKpMWXZhm1v.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307378628091695107/pu/vid/320x320/gzs6zxQIwI1DZBK_.mp4?tag=10

RT @shannonrwatts .@AOC implores every American to vote; says a vote for Biden is a vote to “let our democracy live another day.”

 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307149730934382592/pu/img/Gv16zUkApOac6RtG.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307149730934382592/pu/vid/320x690/6APCKfvAjqODO3e-.mp4?tag=10

RT @elizaorlins “If Mitch McConnell isn’t going to honor RBG’s final wish, we will. We will. And we have to.” Thank you, ⁦@AOC⁩. For your voice. For your fight. Tonight. And always. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1307156690693914625/pu/img/cUO44K_DpC_RAFah.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1307156690693914625/pu/vid/320x690/V6SGtxT1lMsnbFqm.mp4?tag=10

RT @AustinVesely watching @AOC on live, [generally quoted:] "we're all tired, but this is what authoritarianism is supposed to do. It's supposed to wear you down until you give in. And you never give in. That's our #1 job right now."

RT @JoeBiden The Supreme Court is on the ballot. And the outcome will impact everything from health care to civil rights — affecting generations to come. 

Vote. Our future depends on it. http://IWillVote.com

Justice Ginsburg was a relentless defender of justice in our country. She also remained, throughout her life, a proud daughter of Brooklyn, with immigrant roots and a fire lit from an early age as a champion for progress and equality. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiTMhLoWsAABwhZ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1307394330257227781/vid/320x320/tQVhZPJ5HNNkegpS.mp4?tag=13

Justice Ginsburg was a titan—a relentless defender of justice and a legal mind for the ages.

The stakes of this election couldn’t be higher. Millions of Americans are counting on us to win and protect the Supreme Court—for their health, for their families, and for their rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiSQS_4XkAAQz0E.jpg

Tonight we mourn, we honor, and we pray for Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg and her family. But we also recommit to fight for her legacy.

Doug and I send our heartfelt prayers to Jane and James, and the entire Ginsburg family, particularly on this holy day of Rosh Hashanah. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiQAfmAXcAI_8PY.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiQAf0pX0AIBc7x.png

No worker should be paid less than the minimum wage. It's time to end the subminimum wage and guarantee truly integrated employment opportunities for people with disabilities. I'm proud that my home state of Vermont has been a leader on this issue. https://thehill.com/regulation/labor/516869-commission-on-civil-rights-calls-for-end-to-subminimum-wage-for-disabled

That's why I wrote my latest book, One Vote Away, which is available for preorder here: http://OneVoteAway.com http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eh4LpN5XkAESG1B.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1305493052228874240/vid/480x270/zazw3jOjhimJFhuf.mp4?tag=13

Jake, 2 big differences: (1) Biden is explicitly threatening to challenge the results of the election (Hillary told him “never concede”); we need a full Court to resolve that challenge. (2) Voters elected GOP Senate majority to confirm constitutionalist judges & stop activists. https://twitter.com/jaketapper/status/1307143831595474944 QT @jaketapper Prepare to hear much concern voiced about the risks of an 8-justice Supreme Court existing during the 2020 presidential election that was not voiced during the 8-justice Supreme Court that existed during the 2016 presidential election. https://twitter.com/marcthiessen/status/1307132148625870848

The right decision. https://twitter.com/lindseygrahamsc/status/1307382090703474690 QT @LindseyGrahamSC In light of these two events, I will support President @realDonaldTrump in any effort to move forward regarding the recent vacancy created by the passing of Justice Ginsburg.

RT @JimDeMint Are Democrats ok with this? An iconic liberal SCOTUS justice has died, his party is in disarray & calling for riots, and he can’t talk to press at all? If he’s not able to provide leadership, why is he running? Time for the press to stop coddling him & demand access and answers. https://twitter.com/WardDPatrick/status/1307298187775037440 QT @WardDPatrick The Biden campaign has called a lid at 8:35am, per pool. So we won’t see Joe Biden today.

RT @seanmdav If SCOTUS is deadlocked 4-4 during post-election litigation, equal protection is a dead letter. Because ties affirm the appellate court’s decision, we will end up with split circuits and different rules and standards across the country. That is a recipe for chaos and division.
We should follow Schumer’s advice. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EiShshXXYAALEfd.jpg

RT @bennyjohnson I agree with Secretary Hillary Clinton:

"Holding a Supreme Court seat open dishonors our Constitution. The senate has a Constitutional responsibility to fill the seat."

President @realDonaldTrump is doing the right thing. https://twitter.com/hillaryclinton/status/698675522956607488 QT @HillaryClinton Statement on the passing of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/CbIwcbvWIAEdDOn.png

RT @MZHemingway You can disagree with the McConnell rule, which was previously known as the Biden rule, but you should describe it accurately. It's no confirmations in a presidential election year *when senate and presidency are held by different parties.* Doesn't apply this year.

somehow, it seems Joe is going to be running away from this one. https://twitter.com/numbersmuncher/status/1307321797730357251 QT @NumbersMuncher Joe Biden in 2016: "I would go forward with a confirmation process as chairman, *even a few months before a presidential election,* if the nominee were chosen with the advice, and not merely the consent, of the Senate, just as the Constitution requires.

Not surprising. https://twitter.com/tpcarney/status/1307064059511046145 QT @TPCarney Biden’s raised 8 Times as much from Park Ave as Trump has. We have this obligation, without delay!

RT @marklevinshow Definitive case for immediately filling the open seat on the Supreme Court
https://www.nationalreview.com/2020/08/history-is-on-the-side-of-republicans-filling-a-supreme-court-vacancy-in-2020/

Important history: “19 times between 1796 & 1968 presidents have sought to fill a Supreme Court vacancy in a presidential-election year while their party controlled the Senate. 10 of those nominations came before the election; 9 of the 10 were successful.” https://www.nationalreview.com/2020/08/history-is-on-the-side-of-republicans-filling-a-supreme-court-vacancy-in-2020/

RT @RepDMP The Republican Senate needs to honor the nearly 200,000 lives we’ve lost & do everything in its power to prevent further losses. They need to pass the #HeroesAct, which we passed months ago, and they need to pass it now. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1307330301526450178/img/jtYZShpWf_CIIiC5.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1307330301526450178/vid/480x270/p304NKsCsLJI8Hrt.mp4?tag=13

This would provide federal funds to help pay the extensive costs of cleanup and recovery. 

Hoping for good news on this very soon.
